sen.j: 高御座（たかみくら）は、天皇の正式な所在地を示す特別な玉座。
sen.e: Takamikura is the special Imperial throne which tells the official place where the Emperor is.
Takamikura is the special Imperial throne which designates the official place where the Emperor sits.

sen.j: 平城京では平城宮の大極殿に、平安京では大内裏の大極殿、豊楽殿、のちに内裏の紫宸殿に安置され、即位・朝賀・蕃客引見（外国使節に謁見）など大礼の際に天皇が着座した。
sen.e: In Heijokyo (the ancient capital of Heijokyo), the Takamikura is at Daigokuden (the Council Hall in the Imperial Palace) of the Heijo Palace, in Henan kyo, it is Daigokuden (the Council Hall in the Imperial Palace), Horakuden Hall, and later located at Shishinden (the Hall for State Ceremonies) of the Imperial Palace, where the Emperor sits at the state ceremony like an enthronement ceremony, the Chogo ceremony (New Years ceremony), the ceremony of Bankaku Inken (the ceremony to see an delegate from overseas) and so on.

In Heijokyo (the ancient capital of Heijokyo), the Takamikura is at the Daigokuden (the Council Hall in the Imperial Palace) of the Heijo Palace, in Heian kyo, it is at Daigokuden and Horakuden Hall of the Outer Palace Precincts, and later located at Shishinden (the Hall for State Ceremonies) of the Imperial Palace, where the Emperor sits for a state ceremony like he does at an enthronement ceremony, the Choga ceremony (New Years ceremony), the ceremony of Bankaku Inken (the ceremony to see a delegate from overseas), etc.

sen.j: 内裏荒廃ののちは京都御所紫宸殿へと移された。
sen.e: After the Imperial Palace was ruined, the Takamikura was moved to Shishinden of Kyoto Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 現在のものは大正天皇即位の際に、古式に則って作られた物であるが、玉座は茵（しとね）から椅子に代わり、新たに皇后が着座する帳台（みちょうだい）が併置された。
sen.e: The current Takamikura was made in accordance with an old fashioned way when Emperor Taisho enthroned, the Imperial throne was changed from Futon mattress to a chair, the Michodai, where the Empress sits, was newly added.

The current Takamikura was made in accordance with an old fashioned method like the one used when Emperor Taisho was enthroned, the Imperial throne was changed from a Futon cushion, to a chair, the Michodai, where the Empress sits, was a new addedition.

sen.j: 高御座の構造は三層の黒塗断壇の上に御輿型の八角形の黒塗屋形が載せられていて、鳳凰・鏡・椅子などで飾られている。
sen.e: The structure of Takamikura was consists of three levels of black stairs covered with palace shaped portable octagon shrine on top, with the decoration of a mythological sacred bird in Chinese lore, mirrors and chairs.

The structure of the Takamikura consists of three levels of covered black stairs with a palace shaped portable octagon shrine sitting on top, and is decorated with a mythical sacred bird (phoenix) from Chinese lore, mirrors, and chairs.

sen.j: なお、日本古来の伝統から高御座のあるところが天皇の在所であり、そこが本来の皇居だとする見方が存在する。
sen.e: By the way, it is traditionally considered the place where Takamikura is the Emperor's place, and there is a theory it is an original Imperial palace.

sen.j: 大正天皇・昭和天皇の即位の礼は高御座のある京都御所で行われ、今上天皇の際には、高御座と御帳台を東京の皇居まで運び、大礼が終わった後に再び京都の紫宸殿に戻した。
sen.e: The enthronement ceremony of Emperor Taisho and Emperor Showa was held at Kyoto Imperial Palace where Takamikura is kept, in the case of the ceremony for the present Emperor, Takamikura and Michodai were moved to the Imperial Palace in Tokyo, they were then moved back to Shishinden, Kyoto after the ceremony.
